saf.core.ui.dock

Interface Perspective

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultPerspective

    public interface Perspective
    Interface for a SAF perspective. A perspective is essentially a spatially arranged collection of dockable frames.
    Author:
    Nick Collier

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Activates this Perspective.

      Adds the specified DockableFrame into the specified group.

      Creates group with the specified parameters.

      Creates the root or main group of this Perspective.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivates this Perspective.
      java.util.List<DockableFrame> getDockables()
      Gets all the DockableFrames currently in this perspective.

      Gets all the DockableFrames in the specified group.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Gets whether or not this Perspective is the active perspective.
        Returns:
        true if this perspective is active, otherwise false.

      • loadLayout

        void loadLayout(java.util.prefs.Preferences prefs)
        Loads a layout. Depending on whether this Perspective uses the Preferences to store the layout, the prefs object may contain the layout data.
        Parameters:
        prefs - repository of the layout data

      • saveLayout

        void saveLayout(java.util.prefs.Preferences prefs)
        Saves the frame layout.
        Parameters:
        prefs - optional preferences repository specifying where the layout can be saved

      • saveLayout

        void saveLayout(java.io.File file)
        Saves the current layout to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to save the layout to

      • removeDockable

        void removeDockable(DockableFrame dockable)
        Removes the specified dockable from this Perspective.
        Parameters:
        dockable - the dockable to remove

      • getDockables

        java.util.Set<DockableFrame> getDockables(java.lang.String groupID)
        Gets all the DockableFrames in the specified group.
        Parameters:
        groupID - the id of the group whose dockables should be returned
        Returns:
        all the DockableFrames in the specified group.

      • getGroupIDs

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getGroupIDs()
        Gets the ids of all the groups in this Perspective.
        Returns:
        the ids of all the groups in this Perspective.

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        Gets the id of this Perspective.
        Returns:
        the id of this Perspective.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this Perspective.
        Returns:
        the name of this Perspective.

      • createRootGroup

        void createRootGroup(java.lang.String id)
        Creates the root or main group of this Perspective. The root group will have the specified id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the root group

      • createGroup

        void createGroup(java.lang.String id,
               Location location,
               java.lang.String relativeTo,
               float fillPercentage)
        Creates group with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the group
        location - the location of the group
        relativeTo - the id of the parent of the created group
        fillPercentage - the fill percentage of the created group.

      • addDockableFrame

        void addDockableFrame(java.lang.String groupId,
                    DockableFrame dockable,
                    boolean show)
        Adds the specified DockableFrame into the specified group.
        Parameters:
        groupId - the id of the group
        dockable - the DockableFrame to add
        show - whether or not to display the frame

      • deactivate

        void deactivate()
        Deactivates this Perspective.

      • activate

        void activate()
        Activates this Perspective.

      • getDockables

        java.util.List<DockableFrame> getDockables()
        Gets all the DockableFrames currently in this perspective.
        Returns:
        all the DockableFrames currently in this perspective.

      • reset

        boolean reset(java.io.File file)
        Resets the layout of the perspective to match the given file
        Parameters:
        file - the file containing the desired layout
        Returns:
        whether or not the layout change was successful

      • reset

        boolean reset(java.io.InputStream stream)
        Resets the layout of the perspective to match the given stream
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream containing the desired layout
        Returns:
        whether or not the layout change was successful
